e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency and accuracy, providing investors with clear, unbiased financial data. It must comply with legal standards, ensuring no practices mislead or disadvantage any stakeholders. Consistency, open communication, and fairness to all investor types, regardless of their sophistication, are crucial for ethical accountability.
e6: Yes, I would ask the management team about their proposed communication strategies to clearly convey the policy change to all investors, what impact they anticipate on the stock’s volatility during the transition, and how they will mitigate short-term negative reactions in the market.
